intro: Ipomoea auxocalyx, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms in the morning. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
